author: killari.
content: arent there many chains with different strategies on this? Why should eth try to be everything?

author: pietjepuk
content: I'm not sure what you mean by Ethereum trying to be everything. Isn't Ethereum focusing on decentralization, off-chain governance, diverse clients, etc, a strategy that sets it apart from others?

author: killari.
content: well, it depends who you ask those. I think you get quite many answers what eth should be

author: pietjepuk
content: Sure, you can argue about what it should be, but at least on some of those points I mentioned it already _is_ different. I'm also still not sure what you mean by "eth try to be everything". Can you make "everything" more concrete?

author: killari.
content: cannot be decentralized currently with very cheap transactions

author: pietjepuk
content: I'm not following. You said "eth is trying to be everything", but now you're saying "eth is prioritizing decentralization/trustlessness over cheap transactions, so it isn't trying to be everything".

author: killari.
content: ah sorry. I misunderstood, thats one of the everything things

author: killari.
content: I am not saying thats what eth is doing, thats what some people want it to be, some other people want it to be something else. Eth cannot be all at aonce

author: pietjepuk
content: Ah, yes, on that I agree. I am hopeful though that it's possible to inch ever closer to that ideal with all the improvements on the roadmap, but it'll take years.

author: circle.toshi
content: Hey if you're interested in some cultural crypto things. I moved to El Salvador for a couple months to see how bitcoin is working down there. If you're interested here's the first post in a series of posts about things I learned

content: Thats an NFT so my shitty grammar is now on permanent record ðŸ˜¢
